data.name: Yeast Rolls
data.description: Soft and fluffy yeast rolls perfect for any meal.
instructions: Scald the milk and allow to cool slightly.
Add butter, sugar, and salt to the milk when it is lukewarm.
Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water and add it to the milk mixture.
Add 3 cups of flour to the mixture and beat thoroughly.
Cover the mixture and let it rise until light.
Cut down the mixture and add enough flour for kneading (about 2 1/2 cups).
Let the dough rise again after the second rising.
Take the dough and toss it slightly on a floured board, knead well.
Roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness and shape with a biscuit cutter.
Use a case knife handle dipped in flour to make a crease through the middle of each piece.
Brush over one-half of each piece with melted butter, fold, and press the edges together.
Place the rolls in a well-greased pan one inch apart.
Let rise until light and then bake in a hot oven for 12 to 15 minutes.
